data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps right and you should come to a stop. Take 10 steps forward and you should get to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning goes around and goes back to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
6+4 = 14 steps to turn around. 10 = 30 moves = 10 step- change of direction. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The seventh step to Turn left is required to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For an outing of 4 steps, the required number of steps is 3. So, the answer is No.

Turning around and taking 7 steps are the same thing as turning opposite directions. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow a different route, you may need to take additional time to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The first time you turn around, the first time you were at the starting point is when you took 6 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You want to always face forward. All directions from left to right are the same. Take 1 step left. You want to always face forward. Take 4 steps from right. You want to always face forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the exercise Take 2 steps. In the exercise Take 4 steps. In the exercise Take 7 steps. In the exercise Take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, your brain knows that this is where you need to go on your journey. If you take 1 step backward, your mind knows that backward is where you need to go. If you take 3 steps forwards, then your brain knows that you should take three steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must always face forward and face towards the middle of the row of steps. You cannot face backwards while facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

At the beginning, face away from the wall. If you continue forward, at the far end, take 3 steps left. If you don't follow the instruction to always face forward, at the far end, take 6 steps left. This is the distance from the start to the finish line. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Place your hand on the front of your head. Turn your head and face forward. Move to the right side of the circle and move to your right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Every step you take backwards will have you back facing forward. If you always face forward, and all steps were taken right, and all steps were taken left, then every step backward will have you returning to the beginning. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you get a right turn and turn around, you would complete the direction change, turn right. The direction change takes 4 steps, and the total number of steps taken is 8, so the final answer is No.

No, take 3 steps instead of 6 steps, it’s the same problem. So, the answer is No.

Turn around means it's time to move on where you were before. It means take 9 steps and turn around. It means it's the right way of turning. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around, you can take 2 steps, take 19 steps or take another number. If you take more than one number of steps, you cannot take it back at once. If you take two steps, you will be able to turn back around. So, the answer is no.

The number of steps taken is one step. You can not always return to the starting point after taking 6 steps. So, the answer is no.

You can take two steps in any direction. You only take 2 steps back. You can make turns to get anywhere. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around takes you back to your original position. 5 minutes - 6 steps = 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

The same distance is measured in every direction. The same angle is required in every step. In the first stage, you always face forward. In the second stage, you only take steps to the right of right. So, the answer is No.

To turn around, you take 5 steps. To turn right one needs to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

All directions require you to always face forward, not face backward. The answer: No.

Turning around and turn around is the same. If you take 6 steps, you can complete the process in 6 steps. Taking 7 steps is not the same as taking 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you keep facing forward, you will always have the option to face backward or forward. If you follow all of the instructions, you will end up facing away from the person you are facing. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Each action in the instructions is taking a specific number of steps and can be done in reverse order. If you are taking 6 steps backward, you are taking 4 steps backward. If you are taking 5 steps right, you are taking a specific number of steps and can be done in reverse order. When you take 5 steps right and one step forward, you are in reverse order and can be done in the same sequence. So, the answer is No.

You cannot always go back to the starting point on the same steps. The starting point is always forward. So, the answer is No.

If you continuously face forward, then you can return to the beginning point only if you still have forward facing eyes. Thus, the answer is no.
